head.title: NetBSD People: Other Groups within the NetBSD Project

sect1.title: Other Groups within the NetBSD Project
sect1.para: The page lists the other groups within NetBSD, their areas of responsibility, and contact information. Most NetBSD Developers aren't involved in any of these groups, but still benefit and contribute substantially to the Project. Without all of these people, NetBSD wouldn't exist. The general groups within the developer community are:
Other groups within the NetBSD Project are:

sect3.title: Accounts - accounts@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: Responsible for creation of project host developer accounts for those individuals invited to join The NetBSD Project.

sect3.title: Admin - admin@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: Responsible for changes to NetBSD Project hosts. This is also an appropriate contact for reporting account related problems.

sect3.title: Announce - announce@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: Moderates posting to netbsd-announce@NetBSD.org. &a.hpeyerl; currently is responsible for this task.

sect3.title: Mirrors - mirrors@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: This is the group that handles requests and communication with those wishing to run a mirror.

sect3.title: pkgsrc Releng - releng-pkgsrc@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: The pkgsrc Release Engineering Group. They manage stable branches, process pullups and schedule freeze periods.

sect3.title: pkgsrc Security Team - pkgsrc-security@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: Responsible for handling pkgsrc security issues.

sect3.title: Releng - releng@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: The Release Engineering group. They organize release schedules, policies, and pullups.

sect3.title: Security Alert - security-alert@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: An emergency contact address for notifying the NetBSD project of security issues. Less of a formal 'group' than security-officer, below.

Members:
NetBSD Core Group, and NetBSD Security-Officer Group.

sect3.title: Security-Officer - security-officer@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: Responsible for handling security issue resolution and announcements.

sect3.title: WWW - www@NetBSD.org (top)
sect3.para: A group responsible for maintenance and additions to the NetBSD web site content (though all developers are encouraged to checkout htdocs and add anything they see fit). This group also replies to feedback from the web page forms and handles submissions to the NetBSD gallery.
